questions.question_text: The PMO is coordinating a series of interrelated functions to achieve a specific business goal. These functions require non-unique operational processes. Which of the following is the PMO organizing?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The PMO is organizing a program. A program is a group of related projects that are managed in a coordinated way to achieve a specific business goal. Programs typically involve the coordination of a series of interrelated functions, such as developing new products or services, improving business processes, or implementing new technology.

Selected Answer: D
What is a project portfolio?
A project portfolio is a collection of projects, programs, and processes that are managed together and optimized for the financial and strategic goals of an organization.

questions.question_text: A vendor notifies the project manager that the scheduled date for a deliverable on the critical path cannot be met due to a lack of resources. Which of the following are MOST likely to be triggered? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: My thought is, audits, schedule changes and risk register updates. These questions are so stupid. I say audits because I personally would audit what happened, we'd have to changed the schedule and do a risk register update to acknowledge the risk. Am I right/wrong? Who knows, hate this test though :)

comments.content: by triggered think they just mean affected. Milestones are significant events or points in a project that mark the completion of a particular stage or deliverable. If the vendor cannot meet the scheduled date for a deliverable on the critical path, it is likely that one or more milestones will be affected.

questions.question_text:
A project manager provides status reports to a customer on a biweekly basis, but the customer is very busy and only has a few minutes to review the project.
Which of the following are critical for the project manager to provide?
During a sprint, the product owner asks the scrum master to work on a quality issue as soon as possible. Which of the following is the scrum master's MOST likely action?

choices.B: Ask the product owner if the issue can be deferred to the next sprint.
choices.C: Escalate the request by the product owner to upper management.
choices.D: Inform the product owner of potential delays to the work in the sprint.
choices.A: Advise the product owner to submit a change request to the CCB.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The scrum master does not have the authority to escalate requests from the product owner to upper management. Instead, the scrum master's primary role is to help the development team and the product owner to work together effectively to deliver high-quality products. If the product owner asks the scrum master to work on a quality issue as soon as possible, the scrum master's most likely action would be to inform the product owner of potential delays to the work in the sprint and work with the development team and the product owner to find a solution that meets the needs of the project while also following the scrum process.
